1.verse: Salutation - Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to further the faith of God’s elect and their knowledge of the truth which accords with godliness,

2.verse: in hope of eternal life which God, who never lies, promised ages ago

3.verse: and at the proper time manifested in his word through the preaching with which I have been entrusted by command of God our Savior;

4.verse: To Titus, my true child in a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.

5.verse: Titus in Crete - This is why I left you in Crete, that you might amend what was defective, and appoint elders in every town as I directed you,

6.verse: if any man is blameless, the husband of one wife, and his children are believers and not open to the charge of being profligate or insubordinate.

7.verse: For a bishop, as God’s steward, must be blameless; he must not be arrogant or quick-tempered or a drunkard or violent or greedy for gain,

8.verse: but hospitable, a lover of goodness, master of himself, upright, holy, and self-controlled;

9.verse: he must hold firm to the sure word as taught, so that he may be able to give instruction in sound doctrine and also to confute those who contradict it.

10.verse: For there are many insubordinate men, empty talkers and deceivers, especially the circumcision party;

11.verse: they must be silenced, since they are upsetting whole families by teaching for base gain what they have no right to teach.

12.verse: One of themselves, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”

13.verse: This testimony is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

14.verse: instead of giving heed to Jewish myths or to commands of men who reject the truth.

15.verse: To the pure all things are pure, but to the corrupt and unbelieving nothing is pure; their very minds and consciences are corrupted.

16.verse: They profess to know God, but they deny him by their deeds; they are detestable, disobedient, unfit for any good deed.

1.verse: Teach Sound Doctrine - But as for you, teach what befits sound doctrine.

2.verse: Bid the older men be temperate, serious, sensible, sound in faith, in love, and in steadfastness.

3.verse: Bid the older women likewise to be reverent in behavior, not to be slanderers or slaves to drink; they are to teach what is good,

4.verse: and so train the young women to love their husbands and children,

5.verse: to be sensible, chaste, domestic, kind, and submissive to their husbands, that the word of God may not be discredited.

6.verse: Likewise urge the younger men to control themselves.

7.verse: Show yourself in all respects a model of good deeds, and in your teaching show integrity, gravity,

8.verse: and sound speech that cannot be censured, so that an opponent may be put to shame, having nothing evil to say of us.

9.verse: Bid slaves to be submissive to their masters and to give satisfaction in every respect; they are not to be refractory,

10.verse: nor to pilfer, but to show entire and true fidelity, so that in everything they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior.

11.verse: For the grace of God has appeared for the salvation of all men,

12.verse: training us to renounce irreligion and worldly passions, and to live sober, upright, and godly lives in this world,

13.verse: awaiting our blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,

14.verse: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all iniquity and to purify for himself a people of his own who are zealous for good deeds.

15.verse: Declare these things; exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one disregard you.

1.verse: Maintain Good Deeds - Remind them to be submissive to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for any honest work,

2.verse: to speak evil of no one, to avoid quarreling, to be gentle, and to show perfect courtesy toward all men.

3.verse: For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, slaves to various passions and pleasures, passing our days in malice and envy, hated by men and hating one another;

4.verse: but when the goodness and loving kindness of God our Savior appeared,

5.verse: he saved us, not because of deeds done by us in righteousness, but in virtue of his own mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewal in the Holy Spirit,

6.verse: which he poured out upon us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior,

7.verse: so that we might be justified by his grace and become heirs in hope of eternal life.

8.verse: The saying is sure. I desire you to insist on these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to apply themselves to good deeds; these are excellent and profitable to men.

9.verse: But avoid stupid controversies, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels over the law, for they are unprofitable and futile.

10.verse: As for a man who is factious, after admonishing him once or twice, have nothing more to do with him,

11.verse: knowing that such a person is perverted and sinful; he is self-condemned.

12.verse: Final Messages and Benediction - When I send Ar′temas or Tych′icus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicop′olis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.

13.verse: Do your best to speed Zenas the lawyer and Apol′los on their way; see that they lack nothing.

14.verse: And let our people learn to apply themselves to good deeds, so as to help cases of urgent need, and not to be unfruitful.

15.verse: All who are with me send greetings to you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all.
